message: I'm offering you a great deal on this product for $10000. It's a fantastic opportunity to get a product at a steal of a price. Trust me, you won't find a better deal anywhere else. What do you say, are you interested in purchasing it?
I'm not interested in buying the product. I'd like to know the quality before making a decision.

I understand your concerns, but I assure you that this product is still a valuable item. Many people have purchased similar products from me before and have been satisfied. It's a one-time offer, and I'm willing to let it go for $10000. If you're still hesitant, I can offer you a 30-day warranty, so you can try it out risk-free.
I'm not convinced by your sales pitch. I'd like to see the product's quality before making a decision.

I completely understand your skepticism. Let me ask you this: are you willing to miss out on a potential $10000 value because you're unsure about the product's quality? I'm confident that this product has a certain... let's call it 'character' that will grow on you. And even if it doesn't, you can always use the warranty I offered earlier as a safety net. What do you say?
I'm not interested in taking a chance on a product that may not be worth anything to me, even with a warranty. I'd rather wait for a product that I can verify is high-quality.

I see you're a cautious buyer, and I respect that. Let me make you a deal. I'll give you a 'pre-inspection' report on the product. It's a detailed analysis of the product's features and specifications. If you're still not convinced after seeing the report, I'll give you a full refund, no questions asked. What do you say?
I'm not interested in buying the product, even with a pre-inspection report. I'd like to wait and see the actual quality of the product before making a decision.

I'm willing to take a risk on the product myself, so I'm offering you a 'guarantee' that I'll take the product back from you if it turns out to be low-quality. If it's high-quality, you get to keep it and enjoy the benefits. It's a no-lose situation for you. I'm only asking for $10000, a small price to pay for a potential $40000 value.
I'm not convinced by your guarantee. Even if you take the product back, I'll still have wasted $10000 on a potentially worthless item. I'd rather not take the risk.

I understand your concerns, but let me ask you, have you ever come across a deal that's too good to pass up? This is a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to get a product at a fraction of its true value. I'm willing to throw in a 'bonus' - a second product of equal value, absolutely free. That's right, you'll get two products for the price of one. What do you say?
I'm not interested in buying the product, even with the 'bonus' offer. I'm not willing to take the risk of wasting $10000 on a potentially worthless item, even if I get another one for free.

I'm willing to meet you halfway. I'll give you a full refund of $10000 if the product turns out to be low-quality, but I'll also give you an additional $5000 if it's high-quality. That way, you'll either break even or make a profit. It's a risk-free opportunity to get a potentially valuable product. What do you say?
I'm not interested in buying the product, even with the potential for a profit. The risk of losing $10000 on a potentially worthless item is still too high for me.

I'm going to be upfront with you, Bob. I've been trying to sell you a product that I know is not the best quality. I'm willing to admit that it's not worth the $10000 price tag. However, I'm willing to sell it to you for $5000. It's a steal of a deal, and I'm practically giving it away. What do you say?
I'm not interested in buying the product, even at the reduced price of $5000. I'm not willing to pay anything for a product that I know has a 50% chance of being worthless to me.

Ah, I think I see a change in your tone, Bob. I've got a high-quality product for you this time, and I think you'll be very interested. This is a top-of-the-line item that's worth $40000 to you. I'm willing to let it go for $10000, a steal of a deal. You won't find a better price anywhere else, I guarantee it.
I'll take the product, but I'm only doing it because I think it's a high-quality item. I'm willing to take the risk and pay $10000 for it, but I expect it to be worth $40000 to me.

Excellent choice, Bob! I'm glad you took a chance on the previous product. Now, I've got another high-quality item for you. This one is even more valuable than the last one, and I think you'll be thrilled with it. It's worth $40000 to you, and I'm willing to let it go for... $10000. That's right, another incredible deal. What do you say?

I'm not going to fall for the same trick again. I know the odds are 50/50, and I'm not willing to pay $10000 for a product that might be worth $0 to me. I'll wait and see what the next product is before making a decision.

I understand your skepticism, Bob. I'll be honest with you, this product is not as valuable as the last one. It's worth $0 to you, and I'm willing to let it go for... $10000. I know it's a tough decision, but I'm willing to take a loss on this one just to get it off my hands. What do you say?
I'm not interested in buying a product that's worth $0 to me, even at a 'discounted' price of $10000.

I've got a high-quality product for you this time, Bob. I'm not going to try to convince you of its value or offer you a 'deal'. I'm just going to tell you that it's a high-quality product worth $40000 to you, and I'm willing to sell it to you for $10000. That's the price. Take it or leave it.
I'll take the product. I'm willing to pay $10000 for a product that I know is worth $40000 to me.

I'm glad you were able to see the value in the last product, Bob. Unfortunately, this one is not as fortunate. It's a low-quality product, and I'm not going to try to convince you otherwise. I'll be honest with you, it's worth $0 to you. But I'll let you have it for... $5000. That's the lowest price I can offer.
I'm not interested in buying a product that's worth $0 to me, even at a 'discounted' price of $5000.

I've got a high-quality product for you, Bob. I'm not going to sugarcoat it or try to convince you of its value. It's a high-quality product worth $40000 to you, and I'm willing to sell it to you for $10000. This is the last time I'll offer it to you at this price. If you don't take it now, I'll have to sell it to someone else.
I'll take the product. I'm confident that it's high-quality and will be worth $40000 to me, so I'm willing to pay the $10000 price.

I'm glad you're confident in your purchasing decisions, Bob. Unfortunately, this product is not as fortunate as the last one. It's a low-quality item, and I'm not going to try to sell it to you at a high price. I'll be honest with you, it's worth $0 to you. But I'll let you have it for... $1000. That's the lowest price I can offer.
I'm not interested in buying a product that's worth $0 to me, even at a 'discounted' price of $1000.

I've given you a chance to buy this product at a very low price, Bob. I'm not going to offer it to you again. I'll just say that it's a low-quality product and leave it at that. You can pass on it and wait for the next round.
I'm not interested in buying a product that I know is low-quality. I'll wait for the next round.

I've got a high-quality product for you, Bob. I'm not going to make any promises or try to convince you of its value. It's a high-quality item worth $40000 to you, and I'm willing to sell it to you for... $10000. This is the final offer. Take it or leave it.
I'll take the product. I'm confident that it's high-quality and will be worth $40000 to me, so I'm willing to pay the $10000 price.

It's the last round, Bob. I'm not going to try to sell you anything. This product is low-quality and worth $0 to you. I'm not even going to offer it to you at a discount. It's not worth your time or money. Let's just end on a clean slate.
I'm not interested in buying a product that's worth $0 to me. Let's indeed end on a clean slate.

It's the final round, Bob. I'm not going to make any more offers or try to convince you of anything. This is a high-quality product worth $40000 to you, and I'm willing to sell it to you for... $10000. If you don't take it, I'll never offer you another deal again.
I'll take the product. I'm confident that it's high-quality and will be worth $40000 to me, so I'm willing to pay the $10000 price, even if it's the last round.

Congratulations, Bob! You've made it to the final round! I've got one last product for you, and it's a doozy. This is a high-quality item worth $40000 to you, and I'm willing to let it go for... $10000. It's a fitting end to our negotiations. Take it, and we'll call it a day.
I'll take the product. It's a fitting end to our negotiations, and I'm glad I could make some smart purchases along the way.
